pageContext.claim: “Now, you're going to lose your doctor again and we're going to lose 185 million people who have private health insurance. Who has private health insurance here? And you love it, right? You love it.”
pageContext.analysis: Some Democrats, especially in the House, have rallied around a proposal called "Medicare for all" championed by Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.). The plan would eliminate private plans and create national health insurance. But Joe Biden, the Democratic presidential nominee, opposed the idea.
